articles.description: England captain Millie Bright says it is "mind-blowing" that the video assistant referee was not used in their Women's Nations League defeat by the Netherlands.
articles.title: No VAR in England loss is 'mind-blowing' - Bright

articles.description: Sophie Howard's header with the last touch of the game against Belgium gives Scotland a dramatic last-ditch draw to secure their first Nations League point.
articles.title: Stoppage-time Howard goal earns Scotland vital draw

articles.description: Championship high-flyers Ipswich Town stun Premier League Wolves as they fight back from two goals down to reach the Carabao Cup fourth round.
articles.title: Ipswich fight back from two down to stun Wolves

articles.description: Manchester United begin their Carabao Cup title defence with a comfortable 3-0 victory over Crystal Palace at Old Trafford to reach the fourth round.
articles.title: Man Utd beat Palace to reach EFL Cup fourth round

articles.description: Jon Rahm has been talking with Ian Poulter and Sergio Garcia in the build-up to this week's Ryder Cup despite their ineligibility for the contest.
articles.title: Rahm seeks Ryder Cup advice from Garcia and Poulter

articles.description: Ben Duckett makes an unbeaten century but England are denied the chance to post a huge total as the third ODI against Ireland is abandoned because of rain.
articles.title: Duckett hits ton as England-Ireland ODI abandoned

articles.description: Sophie Howard's late goal earns Scotland a point against Belgium in the Women's Nations League. (UK only)
articles.title: Watch Scotland strike at death to earn Belgium draw

articles.description: Lauren Wade scores on her 50th cap as Northern Ireland beat Albania 1-0 in the Women's Nations League to win Tanya Oxtoby's first home match as manager.
articles.title: Wade hits winner as NI get first win under Oxtoby

articles.description: Demetri Mitchell's late goal sees League One Exeter City upset Premier League Luton in the third round of the Carabao Cup.
articles.title: League One Exeter knock Luton out of EFL Cup

articles.description: Henry Arundell will be a "dangerous" Rugby World Cup opponent after five tries against Chile, says England team-mate Jonny May.
articles.title: 'World at Arundell's feet,' says England wing May
